Honestly it's sort of complex. I'm not sure what it's suppose to be about, but I'm sure you have your reasons.

You are a handsome, special guy John Mayer.💖

text:
Yo, so this is the song that managed to deceived and gobsmacked an unfortunate Swiftie.

Get this, just saw a tweet from a Swiftie who said that she heard this song played on the radio once, fell in love with it and had it on repeat ever since, after a while she only now discovered it's from your boy, the antichrist, devil incarnated: John Mayer. And now she's like going crazy on her Twitter. Being dramatic and saying "gonna listen to Dear John for a while to neutralize her head" or something. 😅😂

Saw another similar tweet from another Swiftie about the song "Waiting on the World to Change"

text:
It takes an amazing musician like John to come up with a song with the bass/drum stylings of John McVie-Mick Fleetwood, the lyrical phrasing of Lindsey Buckingham, the rhythm guitar chords of Mark Knopfler, the punctuating melodic riffs of Gerry Rafferty with the vibrato lead sound of Eric Clapton and Jerry Garcia ( combined ) into a song on the subject of dealing with loss through appreciation of our beautiful surroundings. 

Thanks John. You hit a home run with the album, especially with this tune.

text: If you've ever went on a diving trip, there's a phenomenon called Snell's Window. When diving, if you look up, you will notice that there's only a circle or hole where light is only allow to enter at an angle of so many degrees. This video shows Mayer singing inside a bubble and says that he's seen the sky from under the water, this may be hinting to him possibly seeing this on a recent getaway on the water. I've seen it many times and it makes you feel like you're seeing something for the first time. Next time you dive, look up.
